decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of removal spells, powerful creatures, and versatile planeswalkers. With a mix of removal spells like Heartless Act and powerful threats like The Great Henge and Vivien, Monsters' Advocate, the deck aims to grind out advantage and outvalue the opponent. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a companion to provide extra value by blinking permanents for additional effects. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around controlling the game and overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats and disruption.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board with removal spells and disruptive creatures while generating card advantage through the use of Yorion, Sky Nomad. The deck includes a variety of removal spells like Glass Casket, Vanishing Verse, and Binding the Old Gods to deal with threats, as well as cards like Elspeth Conquers Death and Doom Foretold to generate value over time. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value through blinking creatures and permanents for extra value and control.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Lovestruck Beast to establish early board presence and pressure the opponent. With cards like Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast to cheat out powerful creatures like Koma, Cosmos Serpent, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The inclusion of cards like Brazen Borrower and Mystical Dispute provide disruption and protection against opponent's spells, while Shatterskull Smashing and The Akroan War offer removal options. The mana base is varied to ensure smooth mana production for this multi-colored deck.

The main concept of this Temur Control deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful creatures like Terror of the Peaks and Lovestruck Beast, as well as removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Brazen Borrower. The deck also aims to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Cultivate and Beanstalk Giant, while generating card advantage with Edgewall Innkeeper. The inclusion of Genesis Ultimatum allows for explosive plays and The Great Henge provides additional value. With a focus on controlling the board and out-valuing opponents, this deck aims to dominate the late game with its powerful threats.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with efficient creatures like Lovestruck Beast and Skyclave Apparition. By utilizing cards like Giant Killer and Selfless Savior, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect its own creatures. The Great Henge provides a powerful card advantage engine, while Ranger Class helps to continually pump out threats. With a strong mix of aggression and resilience, this deck looks to overwhelm opponents with a fast and resilient game plan.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful control spells and removal to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win conditions. The deck includes a variety of powerful threats such as Vorinclex, Elder Gargaroth, and Emergent Ultimatum to close out the game once it has gained control. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value from flickering permanents. The deck also features a strong mana base to support its triple color requirements and powerful land-based ramp spells like Cultivate and Wolfwillow Haven.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Bonecrusher Giant, Brazen Borrower, and Lovestruck Beast, while also utilizing Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast to cheat out powerful creatures like Koma, Cosmos Serpent. The deck aims to quickly apply pressure on the opponent and finish the game before they can stabilize. The inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion enhances the deck's overall damage output. The Great Henge provides extra card draw and life gain, while Valakut Awakening helps with card selection. Mystical Dispute and Snakeskin Veil offer protection and disruption against opposing spells.

This deck focuses on playing small, aggressive creatures quickly to overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Selfless Savior and Alseid of Life's Bounty protect key creatures, while Luminarch Aspirant and Seasoned Hallowblade provide consistent threats. Elite Spellbinder disrupts the opponent's game plan, while Skyclave Apparition removes problematic permanents. The deck also has some lifegain elements with Legion Angel and Shadowspear, as well as a way to close out the game with Maul of the Skyclaves and The Book of Exalted Deeds. Snow-Covered Plains and Faceless Haven provide mana and a way to keep attacking even through removal.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to mill the opponent's library using cards like Ruin Crab and Thieves' Guild Enforcer, while also disrupting their game plan with counterspells and removal spells. The deck aims to control the board and out-value the opponent with card advantage from Into the Story and Lurrus of the Dream-Den. By combining mill strategies with control elements, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan and ultimately win through attrition.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and graveyard disruption. By utilizing cards like Thieves' Guild Enforcer, Soaring Thought-Thief, and Ruin Crab to mill the opponent's deck, the player aims to slow down their opponent's strategy while building their own resources. With a strong emphasis on card advantage and disruption, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and win through attrition. Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds another layer of recursion and value to the deck.

This deck focuses on playing low-cost creatures with cycling abilities to quickly build up a board presence and cycle through the deck for key cards. The key strategy is to use cycling cards to draw into cards like Zenith Flare for direct damage, while also utilizing cards like Improbable Alliance for additional token generation. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a mix of direct damage spells, creature attacks, and token creatures.

This mono green aggro deck focuses on playing efficient and powerful creatures like Questing Beast and Lovestruck Beast to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Kazandu Mammoth and Stonecoil Serpent provide additional threat and versatility. The deck also includes removal spells like Ram Through and Blizzard Brawl to deal with opposing threats, as well as cards like Scavenging Ooze and The Great Henge for additional value and card advantage. Faceless Haven and Ranger Class provide additional utility and ways to push through damage, making this a well-rounded and aggressive deck.

The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and combat tricks in order to quickly beat them down. With a strong curve of efficient creatures like Questing Beast, Gemrazer, and Lovestruck Beast, as well as pump spells like Primal Might and Blizzard Brawl, this deck aims to establish a fast clock and finish off the opponent before they can stabilize. The inclusion of cards like The Great Henge and Ranger Class provide additional value and resources to keep the pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this Temur Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient creatures like Bonecrusher Giant, Brazen Borrower, and Lovestruck Beast. By utilizing Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast to cheat out powerful threats like Koma, Cosmos Serpent, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures while generating card advantage with Edgewall Innkeeper. The inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion boosts the deck's damage output, making it a fast and aggressive deck that can close out games quickly.

The main concept of this deck is to put pressure on your opponent quickly by playing aggressive creatures and disrupting their game plan with counterspells and removal spells. The deck focuses on getting ahead on board early with cards like Bonecrusher Giant and Lovestruck Beast, while also having the ability to control the game with cards like Brazen Borrower and Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast. The deck also utilizes powerful threats like Koma, Cosmos Serpent to close out the game quickly. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistent casting of spells in all colors.

The deck focuses on quickly summoning multiple creatures onto the battlefield, utilizing Winota, Joiner of Forces to trigger powerful attacking abilities and overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes several mana-generating creatures to help ramp up to its higher-cost cards, as well as cards like Elite Spellbinder to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The combination of Winota's ability and aggressive creatures like Blade Historian and Minsc, Beloved Ranger allows for explosive turns and the potential for a swift victory. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Shatterskull Smashing to deal with threats and maintain board control.
